article.headline: Houston 67, Rhode Island 41
article.story: HOUSTON (AP) -- Oliver Lafayette scored 18 points and Houston held Rhode Island to 15 first-half points in a 67-41 victory Tuesday night. Lafayette also had three steals as the Cougars (6-3) scored 32 points off 26 Rhode Island turnovers and never trailed, leading by as many as 33. Rhode Island guard Dawan Robinson had 12 turnovers. Rhode Island (6-4) didn't have a scorer in double figures and shot 37 percent for the game, including 27 percent (6-of-22) in the first half. The Rams were led by Will Daniels and Jamaal Wise with eight points each. Brian Latham scored 17 off the bench for Houston, and Sergio de Randamie had 10 rebounds and four blocks. The Cougars made 16 of 18 free throws to offset their 37 percent shooting. Lanny Smith didn't score for Houston, but he had eight assists and matched Lafayette with three steals.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
